dt: {bc}to give little attention or respect to {bc}{sx|disregard||}

dt.t: The building has been {wi}neglected{/wi} for years.

dt: {bc}to leave undone or unattended to especially through carelessness

pt: {sc}neglect{/sc} {sc}disregard{/sc} {sc}ignore{/sc} {sc}overlook{/sc} {sc}slight{/sc} {sc}forget{/sc} mean to pass over without giving due attention. {sc}neglect{/sc} implies giving insufficient attention to something that merits one's attention.
{sc}ignore{/sc} implies a failure to regard something obvious.
{sc}overlook{/sc} suggests disregarding or ignoring through haste or lack of care.

pt.t: in my rush I {it}overlooked{/it} a key example

pt: {sc}slight{/sc} implies contemptuous or disdainful disregarding or omitting.

pt.t: {it}slighted{/it} several major authors in her survey

pt: {sc}forget{/sc} may suggest either a willful ignoring or a failure to impress something on one's mind.

et: borrowed from Latin {it}neglēctus,{/it} past participle of {it}neglegere, neclegere{/it} "to disregard, do nothing about, fail to care for," from {it}nec{/it} "not" (probably from {it}ne-{/it} "not" + {it}-ce,{/it} deictic element, going back to Indo-European {it}*ḱe, *ḱi{/it}) + {it}legere{/it} "to gather, select, read" {ma}{mat|no:1|}, {mat|he:1|}, {mat|legend|}{/ma}

The Latin formative {it}nec{/it} in this word and (with invariable voicing) in {it}negō, negāre{/it} "to deny" (see {et_link|negate|negate}) and {it}negōtium{/it} "business, difficulty" (see {et_link|negotiate|negotiate}) is presumably identical with Old Latin {it}nec{/it} "not" and distinct from {it}nec{/it} as a reduced form of {it}neque{/it} "and not."
shortdef: to give little attention or respect to : disregard
